sub_title: Fotografeert mensen | Portretfotograaf | Beeldbank specialist | Slices of life | Enthousiast | Vakkundig | Empathisch
summary:
I'm a freelance photographer based near Amsterdam, a father of two, a former Fiat Panda driver, hiphop fan and I love camping.  People have my sincere interest and are subject of most of my work. I like the everyday normal things in life and I love to take a walk now and then, meet people, hear their story and take their portrait. I graduated in photography at the Royal Academy of Arts in The Hague. Photographing people is my specialty: portraits, image banks and advertising. On location or in the studio. 

I work for clients such as ABN AMRO, Essent, PostNL, Univé, McDonalds, Schiphol, Nederlandse Spoorwegen, Funding Circle, Mastercard, Rabobank, Obvion Hypotheken, Le Monde, De Standaard, Delta Lloyd, Monsterboard, 9292.nl, La Vache Qui Rit, Toneelgroep Amsterdam & University of Amsterdam

erikborst@gmail.com
06-41947021

school.name: Royal Academy of Art, The Hague | Koninklijke Academie van Beeldende Kunsten (KABK)

projects.title: Photography for insurance company Univé
projects.description: Insurance company Univé has been rebranded in 2018. Together with DEPT and Tel Design I created a lot of new imagery for them suiting their new look. The photos will be used in many different places; online, outdoor and advertising.

projects.title: Imagebank Nederlandse Spoorwegen / Dutch Railways
projects.description: Together with Studio Dumbar I created a new imagebank for the Dutch Railways. The photography is about real stories to be found in daily traintravel.

projects.title: Photography for Rabobank's magazine 'Amsterdam en Co'
projects.description: For the magazine Amsterdam en Co I made a reportage about picking edible plants in an Amsterdam park. The assignment was commissioned by Vandejong Creative Agency

projects.title: Internal Campaign for ABN AMRO
projects.description: Together with PROOF Reputation I created an internal campaign for ABN AMRO's employees. It tells the story of a wide range of people working for this bank. This campaign won first price at the Content Marketing Awards 2016
